definition: to imitate/to follow the example of
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: History abounds with great men worthy of adulation and emulation.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上有很多值得稱讚和效法的偉人。

sentences.english: The Church says that its duty is to follow the example of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 教會認爲效法耶穌是他們的天職。

sentences.english: Wycliffe, like his Master, preached the gospel to the poor.
sentences.chinese: 威克里夫效法他的主耶穌，將福音傳給貧窮的人。

sentences.english: He held up for our imitation the shepherd in the Parable of the Lost Sheep.
sentences.chinese: 他用牧者與亡羊的比喻來教導我們效法他。

sentences.english: We further affirm that such confession should lead to increasing conformity to the image of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 如此認信，必會領人越來越效法基督的模樣。

sentences.english: For instance, you can greet your teachers politely and they may follow.
sentences.chinese: 例如你可以禮貌地向老師問安，讓學弟學妹們效法。

sentences.english: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.
James urges us to imitate the farmer.
sentences.chinese: 雅各勸喻我們，要效法農夫。

sentences.english: Follow Jesus example and that ofhis apostles.
sentences.chinese: 要效法耶穌和他的門徒的榜樣。

definition: to hold tight/to cling to/to adhere/stubborn/to detain sb as prisoner
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
to console the people by punishing the tyrants (idiom)
